intro: Monnina longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense, greenish-white to reddish-purple inflorescences, which appear in late spring to early summer. Monnina longifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils.
